lines.text: Demonic beasts. Whatever happened to the good old simple love song? "I love you." That's what good words use. Nowadays they have to write some sickness. It's just absoultely sick and bizarre, and I'm going to do my upmost best to try and stop it now."
Anything you'd like to add in conclusion?
These evil people have just got to be stopped.

[Gazing at Eddie's ruined hi-fi system]
What have you done to your stereo?

[Lowering the baseball bat]
Oh... I wanted a new one!

[Roger has been electrocuted]
Roger, man!
[looks up at Leslie]
I think he's dead.
Actually, I am dying.

[realizing that he is talking to a stereo]
Maybe I'm lonely and I'm nuts!

[Sammi's voice booms]
YOU! Namgar! Ragman! HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!

[to Eddie]
You should be loyal to your heroes... they can turn on you.

[Sammi has just pulled Ms. Cavell through the TV, and turns toward Roger]
Roger.
I am a big fan of yours. I have all your albums.
Shut up! Play my tape for me tonight or die!

[in a controlled, yet menacing voice]
Hi Eddie. We spent the entire morning on janitorial detail. You'd be amazed at what people stick under their desks.

[crying]
Oh, God, it was - it was awful! I mean, this guy was shooting stuff out of his guitar and it was - and people were running and I don't - and my very best friend she was...
All right, all right. What did the suspect look like?
I told you. It was Sammi.
Who is Sammi?
Sammi Curr? The rock singer?

[still crying]
Yes.Yes.
Sammi Curr died last week.

[both cops turned away from the still sobbing survivor]
Looks like we better check out the party punch.
[last lines]
This could kick you off into becoming an absolute pervert.
